metadata.title: CVE-2021-47075 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description: In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: nvmet:fix memory leak in nvmet_alloc_ctrl() When creating ctrl innvmet_alloc_ctrl(), if the cntlid_min is larger than cntlid_max of thesubsystem, and jumps to the "out_free_changed_ns_list" label, but thectrl->sqs lack of be freed. Fix this by jumping to the "out_free_sqs"label.

criterions.comment: linux package in trusty is affected and may need fixing.
linux-lts-xenial package in trusty is affected and may need fixing.
linux-aws package in trusty is affected and may need fixing.
linux-azure package in trusty is affected and may need fixing.
